pageContext.claim: “Last year, I went to them [South Korea] and now they're paying a billion dollars a year.”
pageContext.analysis: The South Koreans were already paying most of that $1 billion a year before Trump pushed for more. The Wall Street Journal reported that Trump administration officials sought a 50 percent increase in South Korea’s contribution in 2018. What they got was a much more modest 8.2 percent, with the Korean contribution increasing to $925 million under a one-year deal signed Feb. 10.
